qas.question: When were developers competing with Jacobi able to match his accomplishments?
What was Jacobi's improved motor used to propel?
Who created the first real electric motor?
Who broke the world record set by Jacobi's first motor?
How long did it take for Jacobi's first world record to be broken?
When were developers competing with Jacobi able to not match his accomplishments?
What was Jacobi's improved motor used to not propel?
Who created the first fake electric motor?
Who broke the world record set by Jacobi's second motor?
How long did it take for Jacobi's second world record to be broken?

context: After many other more or less successful attempts with relatively weak rotating and reciprocating apparatus the Prussian <a2_0><b7_0>Moritz von <b8_0>Jacobi<b8_0/><b7_0/><a2_0/> created the first real rotating electric motor in May 1834 that actually developed a remarkable mechanical output power. His motor set a world record which was improved only <a4_0><b9_0>four years<b9_0/><a4_0/> later in September 1838 by <a3_0>Jacobi himself<a3_0/>. His second motor was powerful enough to drive a <a1_0><b6_0>boat<b6_0/><a1_0/> with 14 people across a wide river. It was not until <a0_0><b5_0>1839/40<b5_0/><a0_0/> that other developers worldwide managed to build motors of similar and later also of higher performance.
